Description: 'Vue d'Apollinopolis parva aujourd'hui Qoùss', study for Plate 80 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; the ruins of a temple roof, decorated with wings and a sun disc, an animal skeleton near the foreground, figures at l, minarets and domed buildings beyond Pen and black ink, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Jacques Louis Petit on plate 80 of Denon's 'Voyage ...'.
Exhibition history: 1983 May-Jul, Brighton AG, 'Egypt & The British', no. 53 1983 Aug-Sep, Manchester AG, 'Egypt & The British', no. 53 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, G30, Hieroglyphs: Unlocking Ancient Egypt
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
